weight.translation[0].definitions[0].def: how heavy something is when you measure it
weight.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The average weight of a baby at birth is just over seven pounds.
fish that are over two kilos in weight
Fruit and vegetables are sold by weight.
weight.translation[0].definitions[1].def: how heavy and fat someone is
weight.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: You shouldn’t worry about your weight.
weight.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the fact that something is heavy
weight.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The weight of her boots made it hard for Sue to run.
I didn’t know if the bridge would support our weight.
Karen staggered along under the weight of her backpack.
weight.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: I can’t lift heavy weights because of my bad back.
weight.translation[0].definitions[4].def: something that causes you a lot of worry because you have to deal with it
weight.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Selling the house is a weight off my mind  (=something that no longer causes a lot of worry).
She felt a great weight of responsibility.
families who are crumbling under the weight of increasing debt
weight.translation[0].definitions[5].def: if something has weight, it is important and influences people
weight.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: She knew that her opinion carried very little weight.
This scandal adds more weight to their arguments.
weight.translation[0].definitions[6].def: a piece of metal that weighs an exact amount and is balanced against something else to measure how much the other thing weighs
weight.translation[0].definitions[7].def: a piece of metal that weighs an exact amount and is lifted by people as a sport
weight.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: I’ve been lifting weights since I was 18.
weight.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 2: how heavy and fat someone is
weight.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He had put on weight since she last saw him.
She lost a lot of weight when she was ill.
He has to watch his weight because he has a heart condition.
How can I keep my weight down?
I changed my eating habits so I’d keep the weight off.
I’ve always had a weight problem.
The medication can cause rapid weight gain.
After the first month, weight loss slows down.
She weighs about 10lbs more than her ideal weight.
You’ll feel better if you lose the excess weight.
weight.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to fix a heavy object to something in order to keep it in place
weight.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The fishing nets are weighted down with lead.
weight.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to change something slightly so that you give more importance to particular ideas or people
weight.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: a temptation to weight the report in favour of the option you want
weight something in favour of somebody/something
weight.translation[2].definitions[0].def: how heavy something is, measured using a particular system
weight.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The weight of the new noise reduction kits may limit the aircraft’s capacity by up to 10%.
weight.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to allow for the differences between sets of figures that are being compared by increasing or lowering the value of some of them, and so creating a balance between them
weight.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The mid-cap index is weighted according to the market values of the stocks.
The results of the survey were weighted by age to make sure the poll accurately reflects voters nationwide.
